data.title: NSYNC and Backstreet Boys to be the subject of a new documentary ðŸ™Œ
data.meta_description: NSYNC and Backstreet Boys to be the subject of a new Paramount+ documentary. The programme will be produced by music manager Johnny Wright and music company CEO Van Toffler.
data.text:
It will follow the boy bands who dominated the charts in the late 1990s

With the exciting release of NSYNC's new song 'Better Place', ahead of the new movie Trolls Band Together, we have some more good news for fans of the 90s boy bands such as the Backstreet Boys and New Kids On The Block.

Streaming service Paramount+ have announced a new documentary following some of the 90's favourite boy bands is in the making, produced by music manager Johnny Wright and Van Toffler.

Johnny worked with the likes of Backstreet Boys, NSYNC, New Kids On The Block, Britney Spears, while Van is the CEO of media company Gunpowder & Sky.

Although the name of the new documentary has not yet been revealed, we have been told that the new programme will feature the music and band members who defined an era.

Speaking about the new documentary, Bruce Gillmer, from Paramount+ said: "The â€™90s boy band era made an indelible impact and will be forever woven into the pop culture landscape. Boy bands remain bonafide global sensations to this day, as seen in the fan frenzy heard around the world during NSYNCâ€™s on-stage reunion at this yearâ€™s VMAs and the ever-spreading domination of K-Popâ€™s biggest groups like BTS, Stray Kids and TXT."

He went on to say: "Weâ€™re thrilled to continue our partnership with Van and Gunpowder & Sky, harnessing the magic and nostalgia this golden age of boy band culture continues to elicit for the legions of fans across generation and the world."

Johnny Wright added: "The â€™90s boy band era was an extraordinary chapter in music where harmonies and beats came together, along with talented vocal artists who captivated the hearts of millions worldwide.

"Their music spoke to the dreams, aspirations and emotions of the fans, creating a bond that transcended borders and language. To this day, the boy bands continue to inspire, uplift and unite â€“ reminding us of a great time that will forever hold a special place in our hearts."

The news comes as NSYNC have just released their first new music in more than 20 years. The song called 'Better Place' will be featured on the soundtrack of Trolls Band Together, which also features the voice of NYSNC member Justin Timberlake as Branch.

What is the new boy band documentary called?

The name of the new documentary has not yet been announced.

When will the boy band documentary be released?

Paramount+ have not yet announced a release date for the new boy band documentary.

You can hear songs by NSYNC and the Backstreet Boys on Hits Radio.
